page.title: 15WILD LIFE IN THE BLOCK.
page.content: Mammals such as the red deer, foxes and wild cats inhabit the hill area.In the woods there are roe deer, stoats, weasles and various mice, the shrew being the smallest. Birds which can be seen include the golden eagle,the largest,with the gold crest,wren and insect feeders being the smallest.The various hill species include falcons,shorteared owls,hen harriers,buzzards,plovers,grouse and black game.Pheasants,sparrowhawks and passerine birds live in the woods. Reptiles include adders living on the hills while various amphibians e.g. frogs,toads and newts live near water. Emperor moths are the largest insects living on the hills while midges,found everywhere, are the smallest. House and wood flies are in abundance as are various species of butterfly, bee and wasp.
